headline: After a Rough Patch, U.S. Charitable Giving Rallied in 2024
summary: Starting with a 2017 tax-law change, followed by the pandemic and inflation, philanthropy had struggled. But a hot stock market helped drive contributions, particularly from individuals.

headline: Constellation earnings, Tesla deliveries, tax bill: What to Watch
summary: Asking for a Trend host Josh Lipton takes a look at the top stories for investors to watch next week. Constellation Brands (STZ) will report first quarter earnings on Tuesday after the closing bell, with analysts expecting a 5.6% decline in adjusted earnings per share (EPS). Tesla (TSLA) will release its second quarter vehicle delivery and production numbers on Wednesday amid its domestic and European sales challenges. On Thursday, the June jobs report will be published in the morning and is expected to show 110,000 new jobs added and unemployment ticking up to 4.3%. Meanwhile, Senate Republicans are racing to revise and pass President Trump's tax bill before the self-imposed deadline on Friday, July 4. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here.

headline: Elon Musk Says First Tesla Drove Itself From Factory to Customer
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Tesla Inc. Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk said a Tesla Model Y SUV drove itself from the company’s factory near Austin to a customer’s home in the company’s latest move to showcase its push into autonomous driving. In a post on X, Musk announced the company had made an autonomous delivery of a Tesla Model Y from factory to a customer’s home, noting the delivery was made “across town,” and included highways. headline: These Tesla-Rival China EV Stocks Show Strength Amid Model Y Killer Release
summary: Tesla rival Xiaomi officially launched its Model Y killer on Thursday, and reportedly secured more than 200,000 orders in the first three minutes the vehicles was available, adding pressure to Tesla in the highly competitive Chinese EV market.  Meanwhile, Chinese robotaxi leader Hesai Group soared nearly 20% on Thursday.  Tesla launched a limited robotaxi ride-hailing service in Austin, Texas, on Sunday.

headline: ‘Dumb Money’ Fuels the Stock Market. That’s Good for Robinhood.
summary: If Wall Street has learned anything in the past few years, it should be that professional investors shouldn’t ignore the so-called dumb money.  While the percentage of trading volume from retail investors has declined a bit from a peak of about 25% in 2020 and 2021, when  GameStop  led the meme-stock market mania, it has still more than doubled from 10% in 2010.  Jefferies listed stocks that the firm’s research analysts rate at Buy but also have high trading turnover and low institutional interest.

headline: Xiaomi shares hit record as EV orders soar, raising pressure on Tesla
summary: STORY: The pressure just keeps mounting for Tesla in China.Friday saw local rival Xiaomi announce exceptionally strong orders for its new YU7 electric vehicle.The car is aimed squarely at Tesla’s Model Y, and undercuts it on price.Analysts say it also comprehensively beats the U.S. vehicle on specs and performance.Xiaomi says it secured 289,000 orders in the car’s first hour on sale.That was more than three times the level its first car model last year - the SU7 sedan - and almost triple market expectations.Analysts say Tesla’s Model Y will probably lose market share in China as a result.That would rub salt in the wound for the U.S. firm, which has been steadily losing ground to Chinese rivals.Its share of the EV market there has fallen from 15% in 2020, to about half that level over the first few months of this year.Xiaomi’s SU7, for one, has outsold Tesla’s competing Model 3 every month since December.Analysts at Citi say Elon Musk’s company may have no choice but to cut prices in response.They say it may also have to offer its so-called “Full Self Driving” system for free, instead of as a charged option.Tesla didn’t respond to a request for comment on its plans.Xiaomi shares shot 8% higher on Friday’s news, hitting a record high.Though they later pared some of those gains, the stock has still more than tripled over the past year.That values the firm - until recently better known for its smartphones - at nearly $200 billion.

raw.headline: Xiaomi shares hit record as EV orders soar, raising pressure on Tesla
raw.summary: STORY: The pressure just keeps mounting for Tesla in China.Friday saw local rival Xiaomi announce exceptionally strong orders for its new YU7 electric vehicle.The car is aimed squarely at Tesla’s Model Y, and undercuts it on price.Analysts say it also comprehensively beats the U.S. vehicle on specs and performance.Xiaomi says it secured 289,000 orders in the car’s first hour on sale.That was more than three times the level its first car model last year - the SU7 sedan - and almost triple market expectations.Analysts say Tesla’s Model Y will probably lose market share in China as a result.That would rub salt in the wound for the U.S. firm, which has been steadily losing ground to Chinese rivals.Its share of the EV market there has fallen from 15% in 2020, to about half that level over the first few months of this year.Xiaomi’s SU7, for one, has outsold Tesla’s competing Model 3 every month since December.Analysts at Citi say Elon Musk’s company may have no choice but to cut prices in response.They say it may also have to offer its so-called “Full Self Driving” system for free, instead of as a charged option.Tesla didn’t respond to a request for comment on its plans.Xiaomi shares shot 8% higher on Friday’s news, hitting a record high.Though they later pared some of those gains, the stock has still more than tripled over the past year.That values the firm - until recently better known for its smartphones - at nearly $200 billion.

headline: Xiaomi Takes Aim at Tesla With New SUV
summary: A new sport-utility vehicle launched by Xiaomi has drawn a rush of first-day orders, signaling the arrival of what analysts say might be a “Tesla killer.”  Preorders for Chinese consumer electronics giant Xiaomi’s YU7, unveiled Thursday, hit 200,000 units in the first three minutes of sales, and 289,000 in the first hour, the company said.  At the launch, Xiaomi founder Lei Jun compared the YU7 to Tesla’s Model Y, pointing out that it was about $1,395 cheaper.

At the launch, Xiaomi founder Lei Jun compared the YU7 to Tesla’s Model Y, pointing out that it was about $1,395 cheaper.

headline: Orders surge for Xiaomi's new YU7 electric SUV, shares jump to record high
summary: SHANGHAI (Reuters) -Xiaomi won more orders than expected for its new YU7 electric sports utility vehicle in the first hours after it went on sale, sending the company's shares up 8% to an all-time high.  The Chinese EV and smartphone maker on Thursday priced its new electric YU7 SUV from 253,500 yuan ($35,364), almost 4% below Tesla's Model Y.  The YU7 received 289,000 orders in the first hour on sale, Xiaomi said.

headline: Circle Internet Group (CRCL) Taps Into Stablecoin Boom Amid Frothy Valuation
summary: Circle Internet Group (CRCL) has quickly become the third most actively traded U.S. stock, an unusual feat for a company with a $60 billion market cap and an IPO less than a month old. In the last trading session, the stock notched up over 1 million shares in trading volume compared to an average daily volume of ~45k. headline: Why the World’s Largest EV Maker, BYD, Remains Undervalued
summary: BYD Company (BYDDF) may now be the world’s top-selling EV maker, but it remains underappreciated by Western investors. According to Main Street data, BYD has delivered over 4 million vehicles in 2024. While building out a strong battery and charging ecosystem, and a vertically integrated, tech-driven business model, BYD is far more than a regional Tesla rival. Its global expansion and innovation pipeline support a bullish long-term view—I’m assigning a Buy rating. Evaluating the Chinese EV Giant
